channel.title: People on Raph's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in People on Raph's Blog

item.title: People or Resources? Let's Be Honest With Ourselves
item.description: I’ve never liked it when people get referred to as resources. Especially when it’s thrown around in front of the people themselves. Chairs, tables, capital, and computing power. These are resources, not people. Nevertheless, a change of language is a good place to start. A danger exists in any organisation where people may be abstracted away from their leaders, in these scenarios, it’s easy to see people as resources or see people as a composition of their attributes be they: technology strengths, experience, height, weight and/or salary band.
